meanings.definition: Taking advantage of opportunities as they arise.
meanings.sent1: She made an opportunistically quick decision to buy the last ticket.
meanings.sent2: He always looks for opportunistically good deals at the store.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel opportunistically grabbed the nut before the others could.
meanings.sent4: The spider spun its web opportunistically near the bug-infested area.
meanings.sent5: The detective's opportunistically keen eye caught the smallest clue.

meanings.definition: Acting in a way that prioritizes personal gain over principles.
meanings.sent1: The opportunistically selfish man only cared about his own benefit.
meanings.sent2: She made an opportunistically advantageous move to secure the promotion.
meanings.sent3: The cat opportunistically claimed all the sunny spots in the house.
meanings.sent4: The politician spoke opportunistically to win over the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The student opportunistically copied the answers during the test.

meanings.definition: In a way that is opportunistic or self-serving.
meanings.sent1: He acted opportunistically to gain an advantage in the negotiation.
meanings.sent2: She spoke opportunistically to shift the blame onto others.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon opportunistically scavenged through the trash for food.
meanings.sent4: The virus spread opportunistically in the weakened immune system.
meanings.sent5: The fox moved opportunistically to steal the hen's eggs.
